185905587.review:
Used to play this game via the browser a lot, then got it on Steam and played it a bit more.
I remembered having a lot of fun with this game - hardly any long queue times, and so long as people knew how to play, the games were generally entertaining and fun. Even better though if people really leaned into the Roleplaying aspects.

This was all a long time ago though...
Then I joined the Official Discord and after a week had one of the Official ToS Moderators start private DM'ing me and harassing me into joining a Loli Hentai Discord server. I still have this interaction screen-shotted and can still access the DM's.

I have never touched Town of Salem again. If that's the kind of people BlankMediaGames have on their team, then absolutely the fuck not wanting anything to do with their games again. And considering what I know the other team members are like where they can't take a lick of criticism and have no manner of controlling toxicity, they themselves will be the reason ToS eventually fails.

185226211.review: Unfortunately this game has gone down severely in quality, and as various reviews mentioned, this game is basically overrun with trolls and spammers. However, the mods usually ban other people for the bare minimum such as expressing a possibly controversial opinion, a joke, etc, instead of banning said (racist usually) trolls/ spammers. The biggest threat to this game is freedom of speech lol. There are many lobby bots that ruin the game experience, and you have to be very careful about what you say and walk on eggshells to prevent getting banned. This game used to be fun back when markiplier and other youtubers played it, which made me buy it at first, but now I do not recommend this game at all. Save your 5 bucks and buy yourself a coffee instead. I'll keep this game just for the nostalgia but don't ever see myself reaching for this again.

185180316.review: O jogo é bom, sendo mais ou menos um dos jogos mais inovadores da sua época para o gênero de dedução social, joguei esse jogo muito, foi um dos motivos de eu ter aprendido grande parte do que sei de inglês. Sim, eu recomendo o jogo, porém fique claro que hoje o jogo foi meio que abandonado com o lançamento do TOS2 (Town of salem 2), entretanto eu sempre gosto de voltar nesse para relembrar dos velhos tempos, mas só o que vejo é uma comunidade que ficou mais tóxica ainda do que antes, não que o jogo fosse perfeito antes, mas por motivos até óbvios a moderação desse jogo caiu muito. Portanto, eu recomendo para quem quer ter uma nostalgia, mas sinceramente, se for uma experiência nova pra você, ou você quer realmente ter uma experiência séria, vá para o TOS2.

184804348.review:
Town of Salem has devolved into a cesspool of unrestrained bigotry, and its report system is an absolute farce. I’ve been playing and reporting racists since 2014, only to be mocked and harassed with zero consequences for those spewing hateful filth! 

It’s sickening that a game supposedly built on community interaction can’t be bothered to protect Black/ir any form of players—or any kind of ideology—from vile, repetitive hate speech. The developers clearly don’t give a damn about accountability; they’d rather ignore the problem than ban the worst offenders. If you’re thinking of playing, don’t. Save yourself the heartache of being relentlessly targeted because the creators can’t be bothered to enforce their own rules. Town of Salem is the last place anyone who values basic human decency should spend their time or money.

184574044.review:
If you’ve ever loved the thrill of outsmarting your friends in a game of Mafia or Werewolf, then Town of Salem is your next obsession. This online multiplayer game, developed by BlankMediaGames, is a treasure trove of strategy, bluffing, and pure fun. Since its release in 2014, it has drawn in players from all over the world, including me—and let me tell you, it’s been an absolute blast.

What makes Town of Salem so addictive is the sheer variety it offers. At the start of each match, you’re assigned a random role, and the anticipation is half the fun. Will you be the brave Sheriff hunting down the Mafia, the cunning Godfather orchestrating murders, or maybe the wild-card Jester, whose goal is simply to get lynched? With over 30 unique roles, every game feels fresh and exciting.

The gameplay is split into Day and Night phases, and this is where the magic happens. By day, you’ll argue, accuse, and defend yourself in a whirlwind of chaotic chat messages. By night, you’ll quietly execute your role’s abilities—investigating, protecting, or even eliminating others. The balance between strategy and social interaction is perfect, and the unpredictability of human players keeps you on your toes.

What I love most about Town of Salem is how it brings out everyone's personality. I’ve had moments of triumph where I outwitted an entire lobby as a sneaky Serial Killer, and I’ve laughed out loud at the absurdity of being lynched as a Doctor just because I “looked suspicious.” Even when I lose, the journey is so entertaining that it hardly matters.

The community is a big part of the experience. Sure, you’ll encounter some intense players, but most are just there for a good time, and the camaraderie (or friendly betrayal) adds so much to the game.

Whether you’re a seasoned strategist or just looking for some lighthearted chaos, Town of Salem is a game that will leave you grinning, plotting, and hitting “Play Again” far too many times. Trust me—it’s worth it.

184488799.review: I'd like to say first that I used to play this game all the time back in the day when it was a free browser game. It used to be a lot of fun. Now it's dead. You will sit in queue forever, and a ranked game will never pop. Your only option if you ever want to play the game is to go to ranked practice. Coordinated groups will go into the lobbies and take turns leaving seconds before the game launches to stall the lobby indefinitely. The same accounts keep doing it, but the devs/mods don't ban them. Who will they ban though? They will ban long term players you've played for years for the most trivial reasons. I received a strike on my account for "leaving the game" because said that I was AFK for one single night. I appealed this strike and the power tripping useless mod tried to tell me that being afk was as good as leaving the game. I pasted the actual rule that said "don't be afk for an extended period of time." He literally responded "yes, an extended period of time. One night is an extended period of time." This C-sucker really told me 40 seconds is an extended period of time. Unbelievable. There are regularly people leaving the game early (you can expect 2 to 3 of them at least every single game). And it's filled with game throwers and trolls. They really shouldn't be able to charge money for this game. The player base is dead, the mods are horrible, and the community is horrible. Do not waste your money.

184442169.review:
Tengo 250h de juego en Steam y tengo la cuenta desde 2015, cuando se hacían en navegador. En total tendré unas 2000h de juego, y no me canso. He jugado tanto normal, como coven, como ranked y ranked practice, y sinceramente no me canso porque es un tipo de juego que me gusta.
Ventajas:
REJUGABILIDAD. Los roles son aleatorios, aunque puedes aumentar tus posibilidades con pergaminos; cada partida será única y podrás adaptarte.
LA ANTIGUEDAD DEL JUEGO. Como es antiguo, hay mucha ayuda e información en guías para una búsqueda rápida sobre cómo jugar un rol nuevo que te ha tocado.
Desventajas:
IDIOMA. En español, la espera para jugar y llenar la sala puede ser larga. En inglés, apenas en un minuto comienzas la partida.
LA ANTIGUEDAD DEL JUEGO. Aunque es una ventaja por lo ya mencionado, hay jugadores veteranos que no serán fáciles de engañar. Al final, es un juego de estrategia al estilo el lobo o el pueblo duerme, donde para mentir, tienes que hacerlo medianamente bien.

Como conclusión, es un juegardo, barato, y que te puedes tirar horas muertas.

184176615.review:
This game has the most horrible community I have ever seen.
I have 90+ hours on mobile.

Playing with randoms in this game truly sucks. As with any imposter-style game, the loudest person wins the game. This isn't even Town of Salem's fault. It's the very nature of this TYPE of game. But it is completley unfair that in the RANKED mode, people are allowed to actively troll and grief games and avoid punishment from devs. People will pretend to not know the rules of the game so they can troll. They know. This is ranked. This is a ranked mode. They know. They are trolling. People ruin the integrity of games so often there is practically no point in playing anymore. Your average townie will win the game for evil classes most games. The people who play this game are either braindead with drool coming out of their mouths or trolling. It is the latter, of course.

I'm saying not recommended, not because the game is poorly made, but because the devs refuse to moderate this horrendous community. From the outside looking in, as a new player, this game looks wholesome and a bit nerdy. A good time! Among us but for grown ups! No. I had more to type but I had to delete it or the review will get striked.

If you are going to buy, get it on sale, and play with friends only. Or never care about winning.

184157989.review: Fun game, I like it much better than the sequel. Though I have my issues with it, it's a fun take on the social deduction genre, where there are a myriad of interesting roles to be and no one is just a boring "villager" with nothing to do (aside from maybe Survivors). I wish it had a larger playerbase, but most everyone's migrated to TOS2. Coven expansion is definitely worth it. (Coven) Town Traitor is the most interesting gamemode, but (Coven) All Any gets the most players.

183623670.review:
This is Mafia that works on potatoes, mobile and browser. It has normal, ranked training and ranked games. It tries to keep it serious about rules without taking the fun out of it.
I can argue that the game is a bit too slow in ranked and there is no forfeight vote, but its possibly for the best because people can ruin the most unlosable situations just because someone said something wrong during downtime.
It also has Coven gamemode with alternative ruleset, cosmetic microtransactions and an ability to disable said microtransactions, an ability to earn ingame currency for good sportsmanship and report players for bullshit behaviour.
One can say that devs do care about the game and amount of players is reasonable to find normal games relatively fast, but probably majority of people are playing ranked, which is why it isn't super fast.
Anyway, game is good, costs like a bag of chips.
It can also give fun scenarious like Trump as a Jester denying townies a win because their alive Investigator who leads the game is named Kamala. I shit you not it was literally a few hours ago and I wasn't even mad about it.
